caption: I have had most of the pizzas in DC and this one is hands down the best. Their customer service is always on point. Some people might have issues with the limited supply on some of their pizzas, but whenever I've had a situation where I don't get the one I want because they've run out, they've gone above and beyond to make things right. Something that seems increasingly rare in this day and age.
Incredible Detroit style pizza! My only complaint is their hours. Who is closed for lunch on a Saturday?!
Really, really good Detroit style and they keep it simple. Would also order just the wings alone they're that good.
absolutely delectable

If you like Detroit style pizza, the stick-to-your-ribs kind that is a mash up of Sicilian, grandma and other square pizzas with authentic Wisconsin brick cheese, this is now the place in DC.  The crust is perfect, with a delicious edge of crunchy caramelized cheese.  The sauce is likewise wonderfully flavorful.  The menu is limited to cheese, pepperoni and a Hawaiian style pizza for now, but expanding and they accommodate requests!  The service was quick and very friendly.  They even gave me a free soda on my first visit.  Gonna be ordering my pizza fix from here from now on.
Authentic Detroit style pizza. One of the best in DC.

I was about to be super critical of this place. But then I paused and first informed myself about what Detroit pizza is and, based on the Internet,  it’s spot on for that style of pizza. The tomato sauce is got a little bit of a kick to it. It’s tasty and crispy on the edges. Took away one star because I think the price point is a bit high for what you get.

This is my new favorite pizza in DC. I love the crust and style of this pizza and it’s even good days after. The service here is also great. I ordered a pizza for 5:00 pick up and arrived about ten minutes early fully expecting a locked door and being told they’re not open yet—instead they greeted me with big smiles and told me my pizza would be ready any minute and could wait inside out of the cold. They also gave me a free bottle of wine just because I asked if they sold beer or wine and they don’t but had some!
Best pie I’ve had in town.

Based on all the rave reviews, I wanted to see what the hype was all about. Since the mushroom was sold out, I ordered pepperoni. Not my favorite style of pizza, but it was pretty good. Lots of pepperoni, cheese and not too greasy, which I like. The slices are pretty dense so if you're enjoying solo, you'll have plenty of leftovers. The pickled sauce it came with was great and wish they'd give you more than just one. Overall, a good option if you're craving pizza, but it'll set you back $26.
Damn so good!
Amazing pizza!  And it came with complimentary ranch and jalapeno relish!  The owner was super awesome and got us some plates and glasses of water.  We ate at the little picnic table outside.
One of the best spots in DC. If you haven’t tried it yet you must. You will not be disappointed.
Delicious pizza (crispy, cheesy, great sauce), really awesome. Group of us ate 3 pizza last night and wanted to get one to go (sadly they closed). Best pizza in town. A MUST TRY!
This is some of the best pizza I’ve ever had, and the owners and staff are awesome people. I hope they keep the side door pizza open for quite a while.

If you're in DC, love Detroit-style pizza, and can't make it to Michigan, head here. The sauce is tasty and plentiful while the cheese and crust are buttery. It's filling so don't expect to finish all eight slices in one sitting, but the leftovers from your pie will hit the spot, too.
The absolute best pizza in DC! Do yourself a favor and order one. You won’t be disappointed!

If you enjoy deep dish pizza you must visit side door.   Similar to deep dish but the dough is so light, fluffy, and crunchy. After trying this pizza twice now I can say this is my favorite pizza hands down. A decade from now when Covid is a distant memory I know I will think of this pizza and smile :)

I am a New Yorker so I was skeptical of Detroit style pizza but this definitely did not disappoint. It is very unique with a crispy, cheesy crust that is soft in the middle loaded with delicious sauce and cheese. Highly recommend!

I had been hearing about how amazing this pizza was so I decided to try it out. The pizza was delicious! I especially loved the sauce as it had great - somewhat sweet - flavor. I also loved the mini pepperonis on top of it all. As someone who knows Scarlet Oak (the main restaurant) well, I am pleased to say their new pop up pizza shop is definitely worth trying! Side note: I also recommend Scarlet Oak for their great burger and brussels sprouts.

I have lived in Navy Yard for almost 6 years and this is the best pizza I've had yet! It's square ( which I love for some reason) and deeper dish :)  the crust was perfectly done and slightly crispy on the outside- delicious! We did traditional pepperoni.... not super greasy which I have found most pizzas in the area to be. They put extra sauce over the top which is a nice touch. Definitely try this place.
Wow!!!!! Best Pizza in DC by far! I have lived in Navy Yard for 10 years, so happy to finally have a local Pizza Spot!!!

I was skeptical considering I'm from Detroit and love Buddy's, Jett's & Pizza Papalis and I have to admit the pizza was delicious.  I've discovered my new pizza place going forward.  I do have one critique and that is the price is a little steep for 8 squares, nevertheless, I'll go back when I'm missing Detroit!
Detroit style pizza is a unique take on pizza and is the first time I’ve seen it in DC/MD/VA! High quality ingredients and delicious flavor. Highly recommended.

This is the best pizza EVER!  I could eat it every day.  Simple and delicious. Easy ordering and pick up process - perfect for times like these.  I especially love the special pepper relish it comes with.

This is the most unique pizza you will find in DC. The crust is super crispy on the edges and bottom but soft and doughy on the inside. It tasted like a cheese crisp to me. Incredible texture. I am not a crust person but this pizza converted me. Plus plenty of sauce and cheese, and the pizza is huge. Not your normal pizza. You must try it at least once.
This place is a gem! Love deep dish pizza, until I tried Detroit style. The dough is thick and crispy on the bottom, pizza sauce is the right balance of sweet and savory. Grade A pizza pie.

As a Michigan native who is very particular when it comes to Detroit style pizza, can confirm that Side Door Pizza is legit! I would compare it to a Buddy’s or Como’s. Perfect sauce to cheese ratio and that crispy buttery crust. 5 stars!  Super easy to preorder online and pick up. Def check out when you need an authentic Detroit pizza fix in DC!
Never had or heard of Detroit style pizza but this was awesome! Light and super tasty! I’ll definitely be back.

Drove all the way into DC to try this place after hearing about it and I was not disappointed.  I got two pizzas, one cheese and one pepperoni.  Some of the best pizza I’ve had in a while and was just as good throwing it in the oven to reheat the leftovers.  Can’t wait to go back here and get some more, highly recommend it and is worth the drive!

Pop up pizza takeout place right next to Scarlet Oak. This is Detroit style pizza which I was not familiar with. From what I can tell it's huge rectangular, deep dish pizza with a special dough that is crisp on the outside and chewy inside.  One cheese pizza is a pretty steep $24 but goes a long way. Each piece is fairly filling. The only issue I had is that it was really greasy.
